title: Rain suspends play again in Indian Wells
description: Rain has suspended play again on Tuesday at the 2025 BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells, where no action will take place before 5:30 p.m. local time. After rain delayed the start of Day 7 action, Tallon Griekspoor and Yosuke Watanuki did step onto Stadium 2 in the first ATP Tour singles match of the day. However, play was suspended at 1:27 p.m. local time with the Dutchman Griekspoor leading 7-6(4), 4-1. They resumed again at 2:00 p.m and Griekspoor quickly wrapped up a 7-6(4), 6-1 win to reach the quarter-finals at an ATP Masters 1000 for the first time. On Stadium 1, Holger Rune overcame Stefanos Tsitsipas in straight sets to improve to 4-0 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. The rain began again shortly after the conclusion of Rune's win at 4:05 p.m., when Arthur Fils and Marcos Giron were forced off court at 1-1 in the first set. There will be no play before 5:30 p.m. local time. Later on Tuesday, Daniil Medvedev will play Tommy Paul in the other fourth-round match. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

html:
Indian Wells

Medvedev faces Paul later

March 12, 2025

Getty Images

Rain has suspended play on Tuesday in Indian Wells. By ATP Staff

Rain has suspended play again on Tuesday at the 2025 BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells, where no action will take place before 5:30 p.m. local time.

After rain delayed the start of Day 7 action, Tallon Griekspoor and Yosuke Watanuki did step onto Stadium 2 in the first ATP Tour singles match of the day. However, play was suspended at 1:27 p.m. local time with the Dutchman Griekspoor leading 7-6(4), 4-1. They resumed again at 2:00 p.m and Griekspoor quickly wrapped up a 7-6(4), 6-1 win to reach the quarter-finals at an ATP Masters 1000 for the first time.

On Stadium 1, Holger Rune overcame Stefanos Tsitsipas in straight sets to improve to 4-0 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. The rain began again shortly after the conclusion of Rune's win at 4:05 p.m., when Arthur Fils and Marcos Giron were forced off court at 1-1 in the first set. There will be no play before 5:30 p.m. local time.

Later on Tuesday, Daniil Medvedev will play Tommy Paul in the other fourth-round match.
